page.title: 15ECOLOGY(2)
page.content: Most of the animal life can be found in the dense area of woodland called Weston Park. Badgers,foxes,squirrels, hares and rabbits are fairly common, roe deer and muntjac have been sighted in Weston Wood. {Birds}have been affected by the agricultural changes i.e.the skylark population falls as the old pastures are ploughed up. The rough grazing on Dover's Hill supports a great many yellowhammers and the fly catcher in Summer. There are great tits, blue tits and the shyer long tailed tit searching the copses in Winter.Collared doves are on the increase and many mistake their call for the cuckoo who arrives here on 24th April.Herons search the brook, sparrow hawks and kestrels keep watch. Green and spotted woodpeckers live in the woods and at night the barn and the tawny owl hunt their prey.
